attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
These petitions are a waste of time, energy and serve no practical purpose.

The country has elected representatives who are paid to take on board the concerns of the population and it is fairly obvious that these petitions will not result in any alterations to the law.

In fact, the sole outcome of the recent Road Tax petition appears to have been an email to all those who signed.

It would be far more representative if the Prime Minister would simply publish his email address so that people with an issue can write about their concerns directly.

So sign up, stop this madness and send a clear signal to the Prime Minister that we are paying him to run this country.  Not so that he can keep asking us how it should be run.

Otherwise, it won't be long before we are all voting online for every single change in the law.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
